title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1936/88 of 1 July 1988 laying down precautionary measures for beef and veal
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1936/88
of 1 July 1988
laying down precautionary measures for beef and veal
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The amount to be taken into account as the guide price for adult bovine animals for the purposes of applying the import levies shall be the guide price fixed by Council Regulation (EEC) No 1891/87 (4) for the 1987/88 marketing year, namely 205,02 ECU per 100 kilograms live weight.

The amount to be used as the intervention price referred to in the second subparagraph of Article 6 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 805/68 for the purposes of implementing the intervention arrangements shall be 344 ECU per 100 kilograms carcase weight for carcases of male animals of quality R 3 on the Community grading scale established by Council Regulation (EEC) No 1208/81 (5).

This Regulation shall enter into force on 4 July 1988.
This Regulation shall apply without prejudice to any subsequent decisions to be adopted, where appropriate, by the Council for the 1988/89 marketing year.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
